docs.lead_paragraph: A new Israeli law that bans smoking in public places cannot go into effect because the Acting Health Minister refuses to sign it. It would be hypocritical of him to do so, aides say, when he himself is a notorious two-pack-a-day man. Instead, he is waiting for the Prime Minister to appoint a full-time (and perhaps nonsmoking) health minister.

headline.main: Rabin's Many Hats: Peace Talks May Be Affected
